base.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to have your main place of work, business etc in a particular place
base.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: The paper had intended to base itself in London.
The new organization will be based in Dallas.
base.translation[0].definitions[0].note_: In this meaning, base is usually either passive or reflexive (=followed by myself/itself etc)
base.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: the lowest part or surface of something
base.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: a frozen dessert with a biscuit base
a wine glass with a heavy base
The leather of his left trainer was coming away from its rubber base.
There is a door at the base of the tower.
base.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: the lowest point on a plant or part of your body, where it joins another part
base.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: a hole in the base of the tree
He was killed by an axe blow to the base of his skull.
base.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: the most important part of something, from which new ideas develop
base.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: India has a good scientific research base.
They were laying the base for a new economic recovery.
base.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: a place where people in a military organization live and work
base.translation[1].definitions[4].defin: the main place from which a person, company, or organization controls their activities
base.translation[1].definitions[4].examp: He used the house as a base for his printing business.
base.translation[1].definitions[5].defin: the people, money, groups etc that form the main part of something
base.translation[1].definitions[5].examp: The company has built up a loyal customer base.
By broadening the tax base (=all the people who pay taxes), he could raise more revenues.
an attempt to strengthen the city’s economic base (=things that produce jobs and money)
The country’s manufacturing base (=all the factories, companies etc that produce goods in a country) has shrunk by 20%.
base.translation[1].definitions[6].defin: the main part of a substance, meal etc to which other things are added
base.translation[1].definitions[6].examp: Vodka is the base for many cocktails.
base.translation[1].definitions[7].defin: one of the four places that a player must touch in order to get a point in games such as baseball
base.translation[1].definitions[8].defin: a chemical substance that combines with an acid to form a salt
base.translation[1].definitions[9].defin: the number in relation to which a number system or mathematical table is built up, for example 10 in the decimal system
base.translation[1].note_box[0].heading: – Meaning 2: the most important part of something, from which new ideas develop
base.translation[1].note_box[0].sections: This data provided a good base for further research.
A good education should give you a solid base for life.
A child needs a responsive mother in order to form a secure base for future development.
The first year of the course aims to provide students with a broad base of knowledge.
You’re building up a knowledge base that you’ll be able to use later.
Permanent staff have a better base from which to plan their career development.
It is essential to provide a sound base from which economic progress can be made.
By concentrating on our core businesses we will build a strong base from which to exploit future opportunities.
The training gives you a broad base in actually running an organization.
base.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: the main place from which a company or organization controls its activities
base.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: Reps will be invited to Bristol, the company’s base, for a briefing.
The Group’s operating base is in Norway.
base.translation[3].definitions[1].defin: the part of something from which new things can be developed or achieved
base.translation[3].definitions[1].examp: Small-scale industries provide a better base for employment growth.
base.translation[3].definitions[2].defin: a figure against which later amounts or other amounts are compared
base.translation[3].definitions[2].examp: All employees earned a salary above the wage base.
base.translation[3].definitions[3].defin: all of the people or things that something depends on, considered as a whole
